{{cpp/memory/polymorphic_allocator/title|allocate_bytes}}
{{cpp/memory/polymorphic_allocator/navbar}}

{{dcl begin}}
{{dcl|since=c++20|1=
void* allocate_bytes( std::size_t nbytes,
                      std::size_t alignment = alignof(std::max_align_t) );
}}
{{dcl end}}

Allocates {{c|nbytes}} bytes of storage at specified alignment {{c|alignment}} using the underlying memory resource. Equivalent to {{c|return resource()-&gt;allocate(nbytes, alignment);}}.

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|nbytes|the number of bytes to allocate}}
{{par|alignment|the alignment to use}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
A pointer to the allocated storage. 

===Notes===
This function was introduced for use with the fully-specialized allocator {{c|std::pmr::polymorphic_allocator&lt;&gt;}}, but it may be useful in any specialization.

The return type is {{c|void*}} (rather than, e.g., {{c|std::byte*}}) to support conversion to an arbitrary pointer type {{c|U*}} by {{c|static_cast&lt;U*&gt;}}.

===Exceptions===
May throw any exceptions thrown by the call to {{c|resource()-&gt;allocate}}.
